description:
Description:
Purpose:
The Director of Business Development (DBD) directs and guides the Community Relations Manager and Sales team.
Additionally, the DBD is responsible for coaching their sales team, which consists of field ride activities and classroom trainings. The DBD will initiate Performance Improvement Plans for those sales representatives who are under-performing, and ultimately will make recommendations about hiring and firing where appropriate. The ultimate responsibility of this position is to exceed our growth budgets by raising sales productivity as measured by admissions per Full-Time CRM. The DBD should also develop relationships with key community referral sources in their assigned markets, which helps to coach salespeople on the correct strategies to win the business.
The DBD recruits, interviews, hires, and orients members of their assigned sales team.

Job Summary:
Manages, and implements all sales activities of Jet Health services within their assigned area. Supervises sales strategies, evaluates market conditions and recommends policy changes to encourage maximum referral activity. The DBD also has the experience and expertise to train our Administrators on sales management best practices, which ensures that growth, is maintained when the DBD is working with other sites.
The DBD is ultimately responsible for meeting referral and intake quotas within their assigned area as established by the CFO.
The DBD motivates community relation marketers to meet and surpass monthly goals.
Grows profitable revenue and builds market shares within designated service areas. Develops annual marketing plans in partnership with the senior management team and hospice administrators that outline how the CRM's will generate new patient activity and create deeper relationships with referring physicians and other referral sources. Generates measured improvement in optimal payer mix.
Coordinates community relations, marketing and business development activities within the region to generate positive name recognition and consumer relations. Develops and implements presentations to groups of higher-level healthcare personnel to obtain General In-Patient and Nursing Home contracts.
Requirements:
Qualifications:
Five years management experience in health care marketing, preferably, SNF, home care or hospice.
Effective communication abilities to include strong verbal and written group presentation skills, are essential.
Ability to critique and teach effective marketing/public presentation skills.
Hospice requires excellent sales skills with a proven track record of success over a multi-year period in healthcare sales.
At least five years of documented, successful sales to physicians, discharge planners, etc. or related experience in the healthcare industry preferred.
A demonstrable history of building and influencing client relationships and goal achievement and knowledge of Medicare, managed care and insurance reimbursement a plus; and
Employee must be computer literate, have a reliable car, valid driver's license, current car insurance, and good driving record.
BA or BS degree preferred.
Job Responsibilities:
Collaborates and implements the marketing plan: Assists sales team in identifying and developing referral sources. Meets and exceeds established referral and admission goals.
Acts as a liaison between their assigned programs and senior management to communicate any obstacles that prevent sites from exceeding their growth objectives.
Oversees admissions which are processed both locally and with the centralized intake center.
Maintains the privacy and confidentiality of information.
Functions independently, makes decisions, problem solves, and utilizes resources as necessary.
Visits with and builds relationships with key referral sources to understand needs and maximize growth and forges other related health-care relationships that lead to potential partnership opportunities for Jet Health.
Coaches sales to makes effective marketing presentations to current and prospective clients to educate them about hospice services.
Maintains a networking base in their assigned communities.
Works to assure mutual goal setting and achievement standards within the sales team.
Attends meetings, health fairs, etc. Is flexible and persistent and takes initiative to effect positive changes in their assigned programs.
Promotes the hospice mission and vision within their assigned communities.
Professional attitude/appearance toward hospice staff, referral sources and general public; and
Performs other duties as assigned by his/her direct supervisor.
